intro: Peucedanum divaricatum, commonly known as the variable angelica, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its aromatic compounds. The plant features tall, branched stems and compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Peucedanum divaricatum is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates.
